-C.value: try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output 'Error:' $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable 'icinga-powershell-*' )`r`n'Module-Path:'`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath); exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command 'Invoke-IcingaCheckClusterHealth'

try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output 'Error:' $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable 'icinga-powershell-*' )`r`n'Module-Path:'`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath); exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command 'Invoke-IcingaCheckClusterSharedVolume'

try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output 'Error:' $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable 'icinga-powershell-*' )`r`n'Module-Path:'`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath); exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command 'Invoke-IcingaCheckClusterNetwork'

16.description:
Used to Filter out which Cluster Shared Volumes you want to check, provided you have
several SharedVolumes on your system. Example ('Cluster disk 2')
16.caption: IncludeVolumes

3.description: Used to specify an array of nodes to include, allows '*' wildcard
3.caption: Include

5.description: Allows to specify for which node state the check will throw a warning
5.caption: WarningState

21.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
21.caption: Verbosity

18.description:
Used to specify a Warning threshold for the SharedVolume, either in % or as byte unit
Example: 10% or 10GB
18.caption: SpaceWarning

12.description: Specify the name of the Network Interfaces you want to exclude from checks. Example 'Ethernet 1, Ethernet'
12.caption: ExcludeClusterInterface

10.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/service/10-Register-Service-Checks/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
10.caption: ThresholdInterval

2.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/service/10-Register-Service-Checks/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
2.caption: ThresholdInterval

8.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin
8.caption: NoPerfData

17.description:
Used to Filter out which Cluster Shared Volumes you don't want to check, provided you have
several SharedVolumes on your system. Example ('Cluster disk 2').
17.caption: ExcludeVolumes

11.description: Specify the name of the Network Interfaces you want to include for checks. Example 'Ethernet 1, Ethernet'
11.caption: IncludeClusterInterface

9.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
9.caption: Verbosity

14.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
14.caption: Verbosity

7.description: Removes the Cluster Resources package from the check output if set to true
7.caption: SkipClusterRessource

15.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/service/10-Register-Service-Checks/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
15.caption: ThresholdInterval

20.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin
20.caption: NoPerfData

6.description: Allows to specify for which node state the check will throw a critical
6.caption: CriticalState

4.description: Used to specify an array of nodes to exclude, allows '*' wildcard
4.caption: Exclude

19.description:
Used to specify a Critical threshold for the SharedVolume, either in % or as byte unit
Example: 10% or 10GB
19.caption: SpaceCritical

13.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin.
13.caption: NoPerfData
